nodes.text: Okay, everybody… our shiny new [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreAdvancedElectronicCodebreaker],codebreaker]] just finished chewing through the encryption on the Argo's data archive. Shall I go ahead and open it?

branches.responseText: That's what we're all here for.
No, I was thinking we'd just sit on it for a while. You know, really savor the mystery.
Use your own initiative, Doctor. You don't need my permission.

nodes.text:
Then without further ado…

Huh. Well, it looks like a map archive. Which is about what you'd expect on a navigation computer—no surprises there. I'm seeing a lot of Periphery territories… the Outworlds Alliance, the Rim Worlds Republic, the Oberon Confederation. But, hello… what's this?
[A star map on a blue background fills your viewscreen. The margins are dense with annotations and symbols.]

This isn't a civilian map—it's [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreSLDF],SLDF]].

Look at the symbols—refueling stations, no-fly zones, even military installations. All laid out and annotated, complete with identifier codes where applicable. And it looks like we have more of them.

branches.responseText: [Background: Aurigan Soldier] There must be more to the Scheria's story than we understand. No civilian vessel should have been carrying this kind of intel.
Why would an ancient civilian vessel be carrying military maps?
You're talking, but all I can hear is the sound of C-Bills dropping into our bank account.
Nobody talks about this outside of this room. We keep this find a secret—understand?

nodes.text:
I don't know, Commander. If there was any military significance to this vessel, it isn't reflected in her logs, or in any of the history I've dug up on her.

I wish that I had answers, but I'm as in the dark as you are. Another centuries-old mystery in a ship overflowing with them.
Beats me. Just another mystery in a ship overflowing with them.

A mystery that could get us all killed. I shouldn't have to tell you what the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreGreatHouses],Great Houses]] would do to get their hands on something like this. And even if they don't, bad things happen to people who mess around with [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreLosTech],LosTech]].

I've heard stories—

Hang on a second—I've got something. An SLDF [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreOutpostCastle],Outpost Castle]]. The designation reads "Nautilus."

It's on Artru, deep inside Directorate space—right on the edge of the [[DM.Factions[faction_TaurianConcordat],Taurian]] border. On the map, it's in a no-fly zone, marked strictly off-limits to civilian craft.
Nothing like that has ever been discovered on Artru. Trust me, I grew up there… I'd know.

This could be a huge find. The SLDF built Outpost Castles to keep Periphery worlds in line, and they stocked them accordingly. That means LosTech, and lots of it.

There could even be an intact [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreMemoryCore],memory core]] for us to discover.

Who cares about memory cores? If there's really an Outpost Castle out there on Artru, that means BattleMechs—the rarest, most expensive 'Mechs you could ever imagine. Oh, and weapons, Boss… weapons the likes of which you have never seen. Sure we've been doing pretty well for ourselves since the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[TBoneLoreHelmMemCore],Helm Memory Core]], but the SLDF mechs are still more than a match for the cutting edge stuff the Great Houses are developing.

If what you've just said is true… if an intact Star League–era armory is waiting for us on Artru… then this could change everything. We could punch through the Directorate's defenses in spite of their unexpected strength. With an SLDF arsenal at our disposal, there would be nothing we couldn't do. We must pursue this, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}. Lady Arano will say the same.

branches.responseText: <color=#85DBF6FF>[Ancestry: Deep Periphery]</color> My ancestors traveled to the Deep Periphery in search of the unknown. I won't refuse to take a chance they'd have leapt at.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Ancestry: Draconis Combine]</color> We're in, but Meyer's right—the Great Houses would kill us all for this information. My own people in the Draconis Combine are no exception.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Ancestry: Free Worlds League]</color> We're in, but Meyer's right—the Great Houses would kill us all for this information. My own people in the Free Worlds League are no exception.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Ancestry: Lyran Commonwealth]</color> We're in, but Meyer's right—the Great Houses would kill us all for this information. My own people in the Lyran Commonwealth are no exception.

<color=#85DBF6FF>[Ancestry: Capellan Confederation]</color> We're in, but Meyer's right—the Great Houses would kill us all for this information. My own people in the Capellan Confederation are no exception.
You have an entire army at your disposal. Send someone else.
Sign me up, I'm all for it.
branches.comment: BG: Not DC, Not FWL, Not LC, Not CC, Not DeepPer

branches.responseText: We'll go to Artru, but I expect a share of whatever we find in the armory.

nodes.text:
Thank you, Commander. If you ask me, we shouldn't be looking into this at all.

Chasing LosTech is a Bad Idea—capital B, capital I. If our friends and neighbors don't kill us to take it, someone will push the wrong button and blow us all up. Again, I have stories—

I'm with the Commander on this one. Chasing LosTech is a Bad Idea—capital B, capital I. If our friends and neighbors don't kill us to take it, someone will push the wrong button and blow us all up.

Again, I have stories—

Lord Madeira… Commander… please. Chasing LosTech is a Bad Idea—capital B, capital I. If our friends and neighbors don't kill us to take it, someone will push the wrong button and blow us all up.

Again, I have stories—

Let me be abundantly clear. If there is an Star League–era Castle waiting on Artru, we will claim what's inside. Not out of avarice, but out of necessity. Advancing on the Directorate's core systems with our existing army would be like marching headlong into an abattoir. We could succeed, yes, but our losses would be devastatingly high… as would yours. So we will follow this lead—superstitions be damned.

branches.responseText: <color=#85DBF6FF>[Origin: Bankruptcy]</color> The Restoration is what's keeping this company financially solvent. As long as you keep paying us, we'll go wherever you tell us to go.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Origin: Loner]</color> Necessary or not, we're doing this. I left home to seek my fortune, not to hide from it.
Sounds like it's settled, then. We're going to Artru.
Let's do it. I've always wanted to go on a treasure hunt.

nodes.text: You all heard the Commander—the conversation's over. We're going to Artru, full stop.

Very good. I'll contact Lady Arano—she'll need time to prepare the recovery effort.

Carry on with your business, Commander. Take contracts, fight, and grow stronger. Soon enough, we will all venture into the unknown.

We aren't selling this, Commander. A map like this is a huge boon for the Restoration.

If even one of the military bases outlined on that thing turns out to be intact, we could be sitting on a treasure trove of [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreStarLeague],Star League]] technology.

Yeah, we could… and if that doesn't scare you, your head's in the wrong place.

I shouldn't have to tell you what the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreGreatHouses],Great Houses]] would do to get their hands on something like this. And even if they don't, bad things happen to people who mess around with [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreLosTech],LosTech]]. I've heard stories—
Caution is warranted, yes. Lady Arano will need to be informed, but otherwise, the existence of these maps will be shared only on a need-to-know basis.

We shouldn't be talking about this at all. I shouldn't have to tell you what the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreGreatHouses],Great Houses]] would do to get their hands on something like this. And even if they don't, bad things happen to people who mess around with [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreLosTech],LosTech]].

I've heard stories—

Ha-ha, Boss. It's good to see you in a joking mood.

Open the damned files, Doc. We've waited long enough.

Huh. Well, it looks like a map archive. Which is about what you'd expect on a navigation computer—no surprises there.

I'm seeing a lot of Periphery territories… the Outworlds Alliance, the Rim Worlds Republic, the Oberon Confederation. But, hello… what's this?
